Experiment Method.Assay Method: In vitro and in vivo studies

Material used.Description: Cells were grown in vitro or used for in vivo studies.

Experiment Method.Readout type: Quantitative measurement of cytochrome c release as an endpoint for apoptosis.

Readout description.Result Description: Cytokine release greater than 80% was considered normal, while less than 50% was classified as abnormal.
Cytokine release greater than 80% was considered normal, while less than 50% was classified as abnormal.
Cytokine release greater than 80% was considered normal, while less than 50% was classified as abnormal.

Biological replicates.Biological replicates: Three biological replicates were performed for in vitro studies.
Biological replicates.Description: In vivo experiments also included three biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Technical replicates: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate on the Western blot machine.
Technical replicates.Description: Repeatability and reproducibility were ensured through technical replicates.

Basic positive control.Basic positive control: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.
Basic positive control.Description: Used to confirm proper loading of probe.

Basic negative control.Basic negative control: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Validation controls P/LP.Validation controls P/LP: Two validation controls for pathogenic variants were included to confirm assay specificity and sensitivity.

Validation controls B/LB.Validation controls B/LB: One validation control for benign variants was included.

Experiment Method.Statistical analysis method: Not explicitly mentioned in the literature, but typically includes ANOVA or t-tests to compare means between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cytokine release greater than 80% on day 7 was considered normal.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cytokine release less than 50% on day 7 was considered abnormal.

Approved assay.Approved assay: Yes (Western blot and cell viability assays are standard methods in molecular biology)
